wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Switch between block being sat within a container or spreading full width across the browser
Select a background colour for the block
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
Select a text colour to be used in the block
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
Select text alignment for the block
Select if you want the content to render 'less wide' then the normal container width
Selecting this option will render additional options allowing the content to animate. Select animation type (fade in etc) animation speed, animation delay and animation repeat
Enter the title text, visual size of the title and code type used (H1, H2 etc)
Select which type of media you would like to render in this block
Enter the title to be used on the tab
Select if you would like the tabs to render horizontally (default) or vertically
Set the height of the block. Default (height based on content) is variable based on the volume of copy entered
Select the background image to be used. If no image is chosen, the background colour will show
This setting will allow you to select where the background image will be positioned from within the block. Ideal for images that have a specific focal point
Center, Top, Bottom, Left, Right, Top left, Top right, Bottom left, Bottom right
Choose the overlay section colour type
This determines the strength of the translucent layer
Select if you would like the link to go to an internal page or an external link
Enter the button text here. Entering text here will also trigger the button to show
Select the page for the link to go to
Select if you would like the background image to be fixed on scroll
Show the option to render the copy and overlay in 50% of the banner
Select where you would like the content to be positioned once the 'half as much' option has been selected
Add a layer that bleeds out from transparent to the selected background colour, allowing you to choose if you want this to happen at the top of the block, or bottom, or both
Background image, Overlay, Text align, Title, Subtitle, Copy, Button
Each slide gives you enough control to be customised
Define how many columns you want the pods to span across before they wrap onto another line
Select the icon from fontawsome you wish to use, and select the size of the font you would like the font to display in
Select the button background colour to be used. If nothing is selected this will default to the colours chosen in the theme section
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
Select the button text colour to be used. If nothing is selected this will default to the colours chosen in the theme section
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
Define which side you would like the media to display, allowing you full control of the alternating media
Select which media type you would like to use
Add padding to the top of the block (default will have no padding)
Add padding to the bottom of the block (default will have no padding)
Select logos to be used. Minimum logos required 5
Select how high you want this block to render. Heights are relative to the browser height
Define how the columns are split vertically. Either equally or offset to the left or right
Select which image to use from the media library
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
Define the background colour of the pods
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
Define the text colour used on the pods
Selecting this option will render additional options allowing the content to animate. Select animation type (fade in etc) animation speed, animation delay and animation repeat
Define how many pods will sit on each row before they wrap onto the next row
Define and customise each pod individually. Add as many pods as required
Selecting this will remove the padding to the left and right of the inner part of the pod, making the content sit flush to the top image
Select which gravity form to render in this block
Create a table using rows, columns and headings
Define the color of the heading text
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
None, Body copy, Black, White, Smoke etc
Define the background color for the table header
Define the strength of the border color
Define the vertical space to be used on the spacer block
Small, Medium small, Medium, Large, X Large, XX Large
Define the menu item title and the ID to scroll to once clicked
Enter the ID of the anchor point to be scrolled to
Select from the list of post objects (news). By default, this will render the post image, title, date, excerpt and a read more button
Select from the list of post objects (CPT Blocks). By default, this will render the post image and title
